"Search filters" widget
The
"Search filters" widget
is used to filter registry data in the
"Object list General"
widget.
Example of a customized widget:
Configuring the widget
The widget is added to the object profile in the editing mode of the widget is added in the
object visual
editing mode. Drag-and-drop the “Search filters” widget from the "Control elements" section of the "Widgets" tab of the "Elements" window to the workspace.
The "Search Filters" widget is used to manage the registry of the
"Object list General"
widget, so both widgets should be added to the workspace.
Settings
If clicking on the widget settings button, a modal window will be opened with the following settings:
Setting
Purpose
Registry widget
Select the registry for which search filters should be displayed.
The selection is made from the drop-down list, where only registries with
configured display of search filters
, which are selected in the settings of the
"Object list General"
widget added to the visual, are presented.
Compact view
Widget display method, when only the search bar is located on the panel and the filtering area is opened in a modal window after clicking the filter button.
Use example
For example, there is a certain object type, the instance profile of which will be displayed for the end user the offers for renting special equipment (for example, in the form of a
start page
).
For the user’s convenience when selecting the rented special equipment, it is necessary to provide an opportunity to filter offers by specified parameters.
Step 1: When editing the profile visual, the working area should be organized by using grouping elements ("Row", "Column" and "Attribute group"). After that, place "Search Filters" and "Object list General" widgets in the container areas:
Step 2: Configuring "Object registry" widget.
First, the
"Object registry"
widget must be configured.
Special equipment rental offers are objects of the "Heavy machine rental" type, so when setting up the "Object registry" widget, this type is specified in the "Object type" parameter.
Next, the value of the "Registry" parameter is defined, in which the registry with the active search filter option should be selected.
Search filters
are activated in the registry settings on the "Filtering and search filters" tab where the "Display search filters" switch must be set to the active position.
This tab is used to configure the future filtering panel:
if necessary, the "Search is applied immediately after changes" switch is active;
filters of the filter bar are configured and grouped using two tables, for more details please refer to the
link
.
Step 3.  Configuring the "Search filters" widget.
When configuring the "Search Filters" widget in the "Registry widget" parameter, the registry that was specified when
configuring the "Object list General"
widget is selected.
